page.title: 16COURT FARM, LANGRIDGE
page.content: Our class visited Court Farm, Lang _ ridge, the home of Mr.& Mrs.Bowyer to ask about the farm.The farm is known to be about 800 years,the age of the house is uncertain but parts may be of a similar age to the adjacent Norman Church known to date from Cl2th. There is evidence that the prison and court room were used for the dentention and trial of prisoners after the Battle of Lansdown.Judge Jeffreys is said to have held court proceedings here. Today Court Farm consists of l83acres; 40 acres of which are not under inten _ sive cultivation due to a variety of reasons, eg.poor drainage, steepness of land making use of machinery diff_ icult.Farming is mixed, some land down to grass, silage has been made,in common with other local farmers, using large black polythene sacks, involving small capital outlay.
